qahramon

Class Purse

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Item
      • qahramon.Purse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container

    public class Purse
extends Item
implements Container
    A class of purses as special kinds of items involving capacity, content and isTorn. This class implements the interface 'Container'.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each purse must have a valid capacity.
        isValidCapacity(getCapacity())
  • Each purse must have a valid content.
        canHaveAsContent(getContent())

    • Constructor Detail

      • Purse

        public Purse(float weight,
             int capacity,
             int content)
        Create a purse with given capacity and weight.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity of this purse
        weight - the weight of this purse
        content - the default content
        Preconditions:
      • The given capacity is valid
            isValidCapacity (capacity)
      • The given content is valid
            canHaveAsContent(content)
        • Postconditions:
      • The capacity is set to the given capacity.
            new.getCapacity() == capacity
      • The content is set to the given content.
            new.getContent() == content
        • Effect:
        The new purse is set as an item with given weight and 0 value.
            super(weight, 0)

    • Method Detail

      • isPurse

        @Basic
 @Immutable
 @Raw
public boolean isPurse()
        Check whether this item is a purse.
        Overrides:
        isPurse in class Item
        Returns:
        Always return true since this item is a purse.
            result == true

      • canHaveAsIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given identification is a long. Return false otherwise.
            result == true

      • canHaveAsNewIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsNewIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid and unique.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsNewIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when this purse can have the given identification number that has to be unique Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsIdentification (identification)    && purseIds.contains(identification) == false
        Note:
        The uniqueness of the generated long is always considered true. The chance of colliding is not zero, but neglectable (5.4*10^(-20)).

public int getContent()

      • canHaveAsContent

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsContent(int content)
        Check whether this purse can have the given content.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the content of this non torn purse is within the allowed range and the additional content doesn't exceed the maximum capacity of the holder of this purse. Return false otherwise.
            result == !isTorn() && content >= 0 && content <= getCapacity() && (this.getCharacter() == null ||
             this.getCharacter().getCapacity() - this.getCharacter().getTotalWeight() >= (content - getContent())*getDucateWeight())

      • add

        public void add(int amount)
         throws TornException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                TerminatedException
        Add the given amount of ducates to this purse.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to add
        Postcondition:
        The new content is increased with the given amount.
            new.getContent() == this.getContent() + amount
        Effect:
        When the new content is higher than the allowed capacity this purse is torn.
            makeTorn()
        Throws:
        TornException - Throws this error when you try to add ducates to a torn purse. | this.isTorn()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this error when an illegal amount (overflow or negative) is given or this purse can't have the new amount. | getContent() + amount < getContent() || !canHaveAsContent(this.getContent() + amount)
        TerminatedException - Throws this error when this purse is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • remove

        public void remove(int amount)
            throws TornException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   TerminatedException
        Remove the given amount of ducates from this purse.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to remove
        Postcondition:
        The new content is decreased with the given amount.
            new.getContent() == this.getContent() - amount
        Throws:
        TornException - Throws this error when you try to remove ducates from a torn purse. | this.isTorn()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this error when an illegal amount (overflow or negative) is given or this purse can't have the new amount. | getContent() - amount < getContent() || !canHaveAsContent(this.getContent() - amount)
        TerminatedException - Throws this error when this purse is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • add

        public void add(Purse purse)
         throws TornException,
                TerminatedException
        Add the contents of the given purse to the current purse.
        Parameters:
        purse - the purse to empty
        Postconditions:
      • The new content is increased with the content of the given purse.
            this.getContent() == this.getContent() + purse.getContent()
            purse.getContent() == 0
      • The emptied purse is dropped.
            purse.drop()
        • Effect:
        When the new content is higher than the allowed capacity this purse is torn.
            makeTorn()
        Throws:
        TornException - Throws this error when you try to take ducates from a torn purse. | purse.isTorn()
        TerminatedException - Throws this error when the given purse is terminated. | purse.isTerminated()

      • getTotalWeight

        @Raw
public float getTotalWeight()
        Return the total weight of this purse.
        Specified by:
        getTotalWeight in interface Container
        Returns:
        Return the total weight this purse: weight of the purse combined with weight of its content.
            result == ((float)(this.getContent())*getDucateWeight() + this.getWeight())
